channel.title: Help plz(experienced coders)
channel.description:
If you think your a good coder i need help with this...
okay, so i added summoning npc's into my server...titan..spirit kalph...wolf..and uhh i made it say the names in the music player so how do i make it so when you click the name the npc pops up(and if you can with a timer or something like how you can only do the starter once)

item.title: Help plz(experienced coders)
item.dc:creator: @xray_veeo xray veeo
item.description:
@xray_veeo wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:6, topic:244546”]show me the error?
and ur SummonNPC void[/quote]
I know i need the vid once i get the void im pretty sure it’ll work.

Read full topic

item.title: Help plz(experienced coders)
item.dc:creator: @xstrxpurez xstrxpurez
item.description:
@xstrxpurez wrote:

learn proper grammar before trying to give codes… also add timers to each of the options… if you dont have the options already then ur practically asking for us to code it for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Help plz(experienced coders)
item.dc:creator: @xray_veeo xray veeo
item.description:
@xray_veeo wrote:

if (command.startsWith("wolftest") && playerRights >= 3) {
SummonNPC(3001);
sM("You summon a spirit wolf");
SummonedNPC = 1;
} else {
sM("You have already summoned a spirit wolf.");
}

i made that but i get this error:

summonNPC ^ [br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 16, 2008, 08:18:22 pm[/size][hr]also this one

if (command.startsWith("wolftest") && playerRights >= 3) {
SummonNPC(3001, absY, absX);
sM("You summon a spirit wolf");
SummonedNPC = 1;
} else {
sM("You have already summoned a spirit wolf.");
}

Read full topic

item.title: Help plz(experienced coders)
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

ya like i said

put it with ur summon npc

wat it duz is it makes it set 2 1, u need 2 edit all of the codes tho lol

making it only if SummonedNPC = 0
then it will work
but if its 1 or higher ( >= 1)
it will not summon the npc but it will send a message instead

heres an example

if (SummonedNPC == 0) {
SummonNPC(2745);
sendMessage("you sumon da jad u fukn rock");
SummonedNPC = 1;
} else {
sendMessage("u alredy has a monster folo'n u faget");
}

idk that wuld work i gues

Read full topic

item.title: Help plz(experienced coders)
item.dc:creator: @xray_veeo xray veeo
item.description:
@xray_veeo wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:2, topic:244546”]public int SummonedNPC = 0;

under the run method thing in client so once u login it sets back 2 0

and when u summon it

SummonedNPC = 1;

perhaps that wuld work pretty well?

also if (SummonedNPC >= 1) {
sendMessage(“You alredy have a monster sumoned”);
} else {
summon monster code
sendMessage(“you sumon a “+name+” gratz”);
}

idk maybe that wuld work? thats freehand so u mite get some errors idk lol gl[/quote]
pretty good help but i need to know where to add it…when i add
SummonedNPC = 1;
would that be under the case for when you click the name the npc pops up?

Read full topic

item.title: Help plz(experienced coders)
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

public int SummonedNPC = 0;

under the run method thing in client so once u login it sets back 2 0

and when u summon it

SummonedNPC = 1;

perhaps that wuld work pretty well?

also if (SummonedNPC >= 1) {
sendMessage(“You alredy have a monster sumoned”);
} else {
summon monster code
sendMessage(“you sumon a “+name+” gratz”);
}

idk maybe that wuld work? thats freehand so u mite get some errors idk lol gl
